name: Casa de la Chicheria

reviews.text: I'm usually not a fan of dorm rooms, but the room at Casa de la Chicheria is very nice! Chicheria has a dorm with plenty of room for the number of people and your bags, room to move around, and thick mattresses. There is also a small pool that's good for cooling off, a couple of hammocks for lounging, and bike rental. The block is very quiet which helps you get good sleep.
reviews.title: Limpia y muy tranquilo

reviews.text: We booked a 2-night stay at the Casa de la Chicheria with the expectation to find another hostel/hotel for the remainder of our trip. We liked it so much that we stayed there for our entire stay. I stayed in the dorm room which was clean, the bathroom was always clean even when there were 4-5 girls sharing it. The staff is very personable and was helpful in helping us book tours or with suggestions. We were able to cook breakfast in the kitchen. We visited other hostels and hotels during our stay in Cartagena, and as for value for cost - nothing we saw beat Casa de la Chicheria!
reviews.title: Best bang for your buck in Cartagena!

reviews.text: As for location, it's close to Cafe del Mar which is nice since that's a hot spot and close to the wall so we could easily slip out to go enjoy the sunsets.
reviews.title: One of Very Few Affordable Places in Central Cartagena

reviews.text: Casa de la Chicheria is located in safer centro Cartagena, not Getsamani. Almost all restaurants and Exito (main grocery store) are within five minute walk. The hostel is small with two private rooms and one 10 bedroom dorm. It is in a quiety neighborhood and the hostal itself is not really a party place and is quiet. The staff (Miriam and Angel) is extremely helpful and knowledgeable and went out of their way to assist me. There is a small pool that is more for ambiance although you could relax; Club Colombia costs 2000 COP at Casa.
reviews.title: Just like renting a home apartment but cheaper!

reviews.text: Although you can cook in the kitchen, ask the day person, Miriam, for some local recommendations under $5 and she will provide plenty of delicious, Caribbean-Colombian restaurants.
reviews.title: Home away from Home

reviews.text: This is a great hostel, very clean and chill atmosphere. If you are looking to party I would stay in the Getsemani area, a 10 min walk away.
reviews.title: Great Hostel

reviews.text: They could benefit with one more washroom and the price of the dorm is a little expensive considering the bunk beds are three-high and air conditioning is 9pm-9am. However, this is by far one of my favorite places to stay because it was so relaxing and the staff were welcoming, kind and helpful.
reviews.title: Lovely Hostel in the Old Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hostel, located 2 blocks from the water in the Old City, felt more like someone's house than a hostel. It was beautifully decorated in a very serene, ocean theme. The dorm room had A/C but i think it was only on from 9PM-9AM. Also, the dorm room had 3 sets of triple bunkbeds which I thought was a bit much for one room. However, since this hostel is not as popular and a little bit more expensive than other places it is never full. So there was definitely more space but it was harder to meet people if you are traveling solo. The staff was very good and very helpful. One computer was available with internet access. The indoor pool was also quite nice for the unbearably hot afternoons in Cartgena.
reviews.title: Amazing location!

reviews.text: Amazing location!
reviews.title: Can't wait to come back...

reviews.text: This house is located in the best part of the old Cartagena City, definitely a gem for its location and value. Staff is really friendly, you feel like home here. There are three types of rooms, a private one with bathroom, a semi privet one with shared bathroom and a hostel style room.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!!! :-)

reviews.text: Cartagena is hot, really hot. So, if you're a budget traveller, you'll appreciate the a/c in the hostel's 9-bed (plus loft) dorm. You'll also appreciate the friendly English-speaking staff, which are willing to go above and beyond to find information for you on Cartagena and other spots in Colombia.
reviews.title: Nice laid back atmosphere, a/c dorm

reviews.text: The small pool -- perfect for a quick dip or sitting with your feet hanging in -- is a nice feature. As are the two hammocks situated next to a small goldfish pond. Further, wifi is fast and available throughout the majority of hostel.
reviews.title: Comfortable and cozy little spot

reviews.text: Dorm beds are made up daily by the excellent housekeeper, which is a nice touch. Overall, the hostel is kept very clean. I do think that they could do a better job, though, of keeping the men's bathroom clean, particularly the shower/toilet area. Water, sand and dirt tend to pool in the area in front of the toilet and next to the shower, so it can be pretty nasty for the person who has to use the toilet after a couple showers have been taken. Also, while the women's bathroom features a nice rainforest-style shower head in a glass enclosure, the men's shower is a bit more basic. Some gender parity would be good.
reviews.title: Excellent Place

reviews.text: Location is excellent -- a few steps from the city wall, which makes for a nice place to watch the sun go down. It's also in a much safer, quieter and more beautiful area of the city than where the majority of the budget hostels/hotels are located on Media Luna.
reviews.title: Nice place, good price, great staff

reviews.text: The hostel advertises itself as a 'boutique hostel' -- in reality, I think it's just a solid hostel. If the bathrooms were kept a bit cleaner, towels were provided without asking, and perhaps a small breakfast was added to the deal, this would be a five-star hostel indeed.
reviews.title: All around comfortable

reviews.text: Spend There 4 nights in The meantime travelling to other places. Cheap, clean, with Thomas in charge and Jeffe makes People feel comfortable. whatever You need they are to help You.
reviews.title: Friendly place, cheap, clean, Family time

reviews.text: Laundry made The same day, deposit boxes, small swimming pool.
reviews.title: Best value in Cartagena.

reviews.text: Would definiately coming back!!!
reviews.title: Beautiful and very clean

reviews.text: Krystian, el Polaco
reviews.title: My favourite hostel in Colombia so far

reviews.text: We stayed at chicheria for a night in the dorms and found it to be a great value for a place to stay in cartgena. It's quiet and located close to everything.
reviews.title: Wonderful hostel for travelers on a budget

description: Casa de la Chicheria is a luxurious open plan house, located in beautiful El Centro. It's a colonial house with modern facilities - rooftop terrace, pool, fully equipped kitchen and a bbq area that is the perfect setting for a dinner party with new friends. All bedrooms are air-conditioned. We offer our guests exclusive access to activities including wake boarding lessons with a professional, private catamaran charter cruises, and access to a privately owned casa on the Rosario Islands.
